Documentation

Moose is a cloud service to make studio-quality audio calls.
Thank you for your consideration.
Howto
Your administrator creates a session setting APIKEY. They will give you an url like this to start. www.example.com/line.html?apikey=abcd#generate_leaf
Click Join, and share the browser url with the peer to join on Slack, email, etc.
Customers
We suggest it for professionals, private conversations, and all who quickly need a backup of their usual channel.
Why?
We wanted to create an industry benchmark service. It is a simple software stack that everybody can verify and replicate.
Cost
You pay us, and we pay for the cloud hardware, product quality, and we protect your data.
Telemetry
We collect data that is necessary for reliability not marketing. We do not sell it. We do not use cookies.
Latency
The raw audio format has a bandwidth of 3.2 megabits per second upstream and downstream. The benefit is the lower support cost, hardware independence, and lower latency.
Quality
The design principle is quality. We use a sample rate like the 192KHz studio quality and 16 bits precision. Our 200 kHz sampling rate provides 4x precision gains over the standard 44KHz. 24-bits may give an additional 256x deemed unnecessary.
Alternatives
Our solution allows only one peer to protect your privacy. This is what it is for. You can choose alternatives if you need features like a group chat. You can try Zoom™, Skype™, WeChat™, or stuff from Facebook™ or Google™.
WebRTC
Why not WebRTC? WebRTC is great if you rely on your hardware and OS codecs, and you need many features. It relies on external dependencies, which may contain vulnerabilities. Our goal is to be the ultimate benchmark backup call to test against.
Open
We posted the codebase to https://gitlab.com/eper.io/moose_assist. Secure it using the compliant practices of your organization and locale.
E2E
The first pillar of security is end-to-end encryption. We use 256-bit AES-CTR. The silent channel is unencoded, ensuring that the initialization and natural audio vectors are unique together.
Persistent Threat
Be wary of end-to-end encryption. The reason is that it only deters casual attackers. Targeted attackers would steal the private keys from the endpoints. Malware and in-room cameras are as dangerous as an unencrypted channel.
Use
We designed our service for professional use. Criminal activity is not tolerated.
Security by Isolation
The second pillar of security is an isolated virtual server for the lifetime of the connection. If you need simple end-to-end encryption using a password and the TLS closure of your PaaS provider, you may want to opt for Zoom™, Hangouts℠, etc.
Standard Security
We also use TLS 1.3 and API keys to ensure that you paid for the container.
Browsers
The supported browsers are Chrome, Edge, Opera, and Safari
Business
Business? Send us an email.
